department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.ch: Plasma is generally referred to as the fourth state of matter or the ionized gas. The interaction of many charged particles with the electromagnetic fields is the essence of plasma physics. This course will focus on the physics of plasmas occurring in the solar system with applications to the Sun, interplanetary space and Earth’s space environments, etc.  The objective of this course is to establish the students’ fundamental theory and methodology of space plasma physics.
goal.en: Plasma is generally referred to as the fourth state of matter or the ionized gas. The interaction of many charged particles with the electromagnetic fields is the essence of plasma physics. This course will focus on the physics of plasmas occurring in the solar system with applications to the Sun, interplanetary space and Earth’s space environments, etc.  The objective of this course is to establish the students’ fundamental theory and methodology of space plasma physics.

outline.ch: The contents include an introduction, the formulation of kinetic and fluid models of plasmas, theory of magnetohydrodynamics, linear plasma waves, shocks and discontinuities, plasma equilibrium, current sheet and hydromagnetic instabilities, etc.
outline.en: The contents include an introduction, the formulation of kinetic and fluid models of plasmas, theory of magnetohydrodynamics, linear plasma waves, shocks and discontinuities, plasma equilibrium, current sheet and hydromagnetic instabilities, etc.

textbook.ch:
(1)Class notes prepared by Prof. Hau.
(2)Basic Space Plasma Physics by Wolfgang Baumjohann and Rudolf A Treumann, Imperial College Press, London, U.K.
(3)Introduction to Plasma Physics: With Space, Laboratory and Astrophysical Applications by Donald A. Burnett and Amitatava Bhattacharjee, Cambridge University Press, U.K.
(4)Introduction to Plasma Physics and Controlled Fusion by Francis F. Chen, Springer. 
(5)Elementary Space Plasma Physics by Ling-Hsiao, Lyu, Second Edition, Airiti Press, Taiwan, R.O.C
